DataElement.preferredDefinition: The patient's score on the International Prognostic Index, which assesses how a non-Hodgkins lymphoma patient might respond to treatment or may predict survival following therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a patient's International Prognostic Index, which is comprised of five factors that help doctors assess how a non-Hodgkins lymphoma patient might respond to a certain treatment or predict the risk of disease recurrence and survival following therapy; the factors are: 1) patient's age, 2) stage of disease: an indication of how localized or widespread is the disease, 3) LDH levels: serum levels often correlate with the amount of tumor in the body, 4) the number of extranodal, non-lymphatic sites found, 5) the patient's overall health.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A list of five factors that help doctors assess how a non-Hodgkins lymphoma patient might respond to a certain treatment or predict the risk of disease recurrence and survival following therapy.  The factors are: 1) patient's age, 2) stage of disease: an indication of how localized or widespread is the disease, 3) LDH levels: serum levels often correlate with the amount of tumor in the body, 4) the number of extranodal, non-lymphatic sites found, 5) the patient's overall health. (from Lymphoma Research Foundation of America glossary (www.lymphoma.org))

Concepts.definition: A list of five factors that help doctors assess how a non-Hodgkin lymphoma patient might respond to a certain treatment or predict the risk of disease recurrence and survival following therapy.  The factors are: 1) patient's age, 2) stage of disease: an indication of how localized or widespread is the disease, 3) LDH levels: serum levels often correlate with the amount of tumor in the body, 4) the number of extranodal, non-lymphatic sites found, 5) the patient's overall health. (from Lymphoma Research Foundation of America glossary (www.lymphoma.org))

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's score on the International Prognostic Index, which assesses how a non-Hodgkins lymphoma patient might respond to treatment or may predict survival following therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A score of 0 or 1 on the International Prognostic Index indicating that an individual has a low risk of progression of non-Hodgkin lymphoma and a 5 year survival of 73%.

Concepts.definition: A score of 0 or 1 on the International Prognostic Index indicating that an individual has a low risk of progression of non-Hodgkin lymphoma and a 5 year survival of 73%.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A score of 2 on the International Prognostic Index indicating that an individual has a low-intermediate risk of progression of non-Hodgkin lymphoma and a 5 year survival of 69%.

Concepts.definition: A score of 2 on the International Prognostic Index indicating that an individual has a low-intermediate risk of progression of non-Hodgkin lymphoma and a 5 year survival of 69%.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A score of 3 on the International Prognostic Index indicating that an individual has a high-intermediate risk of progression of non-Hodgkin lymphoma and a 5 year survival of 46%.

Concepts.definition: A score of 3 on the International Prognostic Index indicating that an individual has a high-intermediate risk of progression of non-Hodgkin lymphoma and a 5 year survival of 46%.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A score of 4 or 5 on the International Prognostic Index indicating that an individual has a high risk of progression of non-Hodgkin lymphoma and a 5 year survival of 32%.

Concepts.definition: A score of 4 or 5 on the International Prognostic Index indicating that an individual has a high risk of progression of non-Hodgkin lymphoma and a 5 year survival of 32%.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Score; a number or letter indicating quality.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.origin: AMC CRF:AIDS Malignancy Consortium Case Report Form

ClassificationSchemes.longName: CDDP/CTSP (Cancer Driver Discovery Program/Clinical Trial Sequencing Project)
